A handmade clubSandwich for multi-site trials

sandwiches
robust variance estimation
econometrics
weighting
instrumental variables
Author

admin

Published

March 9, 2019

library(tidyverse)
data(STAR, package = "AER")

STAR_urban <-
  STAR %>%
  filter(
    # limit to urban/inner city schools
    schoolk %in% c("urban","inner-city"),
    # limit to complete outcome data
    !is.na(readk), !is.na(mathk)
  ) %>%
  droplevels() %>%
  # collapse control conditions
  mutate(
    stark = fct_collapse(stark, regular = c("regular","regular+aide"))
  ) %>%
  # calculate inverse-propensity weight
  group_by(schoolidk) %>%
  mutate(
    n = n(),
    nT = sum(stark=="small"),
    wt = ifelse(stark=="small", n / nT, n / (n - nT))
  ) %>%
  select(schoolidk, stark, readk, mathk, wt)

STAR_summary <- 
  STAR_urban %>%
  count(schoolidk)

STAR_urban %>%
  group_by(schoolidk, stark) %>%
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    wt = sum(wt)
  ) %>%
  mutate(n = sum(n)) %>%
  spread(stark, wt)
# A tibble: 23 × 4
# Groups:   schoolidk [23]
   schoolidk     n regular small
   <fct>     <int>   <dbl> <dbl>
 1 2            52      52    52
 2 9           120     120   120
 3 10           51      51    51
 4 14           34      34    34
 5 15           55      55    55
 6 16          105     105   105
 7 18           79      79    79
 8 19           99      99    99
 9 22          129     129   129
10 26           49      49    49
# ℹ 13 more rows

After these exclusions, the data include a total of {r} sum(STAR_summary$n) students from {r} nrow(STAR_summary) schools, ranging in size from {r} min(STAR_summary$n) to {r} max(STAR_summary$n) students.

For starters, let’s get the average impacts using a seeming unrelated regression specification, with both conventional and clubSandwich standard errors.

library(clubSandwich)
Registered S3 method overwritten by 'clubSandwich':
  method    from    
  bread.mlm sandwich
STAR_wt <- lm(cbind(readk, mathk) ~ 0 + schoolidk + stark, weights = wt, data = STAR_urban)

# conventional SEs
CR0 <- 
  coef_test(STAR_wt, vcov = "CR0", 
            cluster = STAR_urban$schoolidk, 
            test = "z",
            coefs = c("readk:starksmall","mathk:starksmall"))
CR0
            Coef. Estimate   SE t-stat d.f. (z) p-val (z) Sig.
 readk:starksmall     6.21 3.13   1.98      Inf    0.0473    *
 mathk:starksmall    12.47 5.58   2.23      Inf    0.0254    *
# clubSandwich SEs
CR2 <- 
  coef_test(STAR_wt, vcov = "CR2", 
            cluster = STAR_urban$schoolidk, 
            coefs = c("readk:starksmall","mathk:starksmall"))

CR2
            Coef. Estimate   SE t-stat d.f. (Satt) p-val (Satt) Sig.
 readk:starksmall     6.21 2.70    2.3          19       0.0332    *
 mathk:starksmall    12.47 4.79    2.6          19       0.0174    *

Now I’ll do it “by hand”—or rather, with a bit of dplyr:

# summary statistics by site

school_summaries <- 
  STAR_urban %>%
  group_by(schoolidk, stark) %>%
  summarise(
    # means by arm and site
    readk = mean(readk),
    mathk = mean(mathk),
    n_arm = n()
  ) %>%
  summarise(
    # impact estimates by site
    readk = diff(readk),
    mathk = diff(mathk),
    n = sum(n_arm),
    p = n_arm[stark=="small"] / n
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    w = n
  )
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'schoolidk'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
# overall impacts

school_summaries %>%
  gather("subject","impact_j", readk, mathk) %>%
  group_by(subject) %>%
  summarise(
    impact = weighted.mean(impact_j, w = w),
    SE_CR0 = sqrt(sum(w^2 * (impact_j - impact)^2) / sum(w)^2),
    SE_CR2 = sqrt(sum(w^2 * (impact_j - impact)^2 / (1 - w / sum(w))) / sum(w)^2),
    df_CR2 = 1 / (sum(w^2 / (sum(w) - w)^2) - 
                    2 * sum(w^3 / (sum(w) - w)^2) / sum(w) + 
                    sum(w^2 / (sum(w) - w))^2 / sum(w)^2)
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable(digits = 2)
subject impact SE_CR0 SE_CR2 df_CR2
mathk 12.47 5.58 5.76 19.07
readk 6.21 3.13 3.23 19.07

The CR0 and CR2 standard errors match the results from coef_test, as do the Satterthwaite degrees of freedom. Note that the degrees of freedom are equal to {r} round(CR2$df[1], 1) in this case, a bit less than \(J - 1 = 22\) due to variation in the weight assigned to each school.

```{r, message = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
data(STAR, package = "AER")

STAR_urban <-
  STAR %>%
  filter(
    # limit to urban/inner city schools
    schoolk %in% c("urban","inner-city"),
    # limit to complete outcome data
    !is.na(readk), !is.na(mathk)
  ) %>%
  droplevels() %>%
  # collapse control conditions
  mutate(
    stark = fct_collapse(stark, regular = c("regular","regular+aide"))
  ) %>%
  # calculate inverse-propensity weight
  group_by(schoolidk) %>%
  mutate(
    n = n(),
    nT = sum(stark=="small"),
    wt = ifelse(stark=="small", n / nT, n / (n - nT))
  ) %>%
  select(schoolidk, stark, readk, mathk, wt)

STAR_summary <- 
  STAR_urban %>%
  count(schoolidk)

STAR_urban %>%
  group_by(schoolidk, stark) %>%
  summarise(
    n = n(),
    wt = sum(wt)
  ) %>%
  mutate(n = sum(n)) %>%
  spread(stark, wt)

```
After these exclusions, the data include a total of `{r} sum(STAR_summary$n)` students from `{r} nrow(STAR_summary)` schools, ranging in size from `{r} min(STAR_summary$n)` to `{r} max(STAR_summary$n)` students.

For starters, let's get the average impacts using a seeming unrelated regression specification, with both conventional and clubSandwich standard errors. 
```{r}
library(clubSandwich)
```

```{r}
STAR_wt <- lm(cbind(readk, mathk) ~ 0 + schoolidk + stark, weights = wt, data = STAR_urban)

# conventional SEs
CR0 <- 
  coef_test(STAR_wt, vcov = "CR0", 
            cluster = STAR_urban$schoolidk, 
            test = "z",
            coefs = c("readk:starksmall","mathk:starksmall"))
CR0

# clubSandwich SEs
CR2 <- 
  coef_test(STAR_wt, vcov = "CR2", 
            cluster = STAR_urban$schoolidk, 
            coefs = c("readk:starksmall","mathk:starksmall"))

CR2
```

Now I'll do it "by hand"---or rather, with a bit of `dplyr`:

```{r}
# summary statistics by site

school_summaries <- 
  STAR_urban %>%
  group_by(schoolidk, stark) %>%
  summarise(
    # means by arm and site
    readk = mean(readk),
    mathk = mean(mathk),
    n_arm = n()
  ) %>%
  summarise(
    # impact estimates by site
    readk = diff(readk),
    mathk = diff(mathk),
    n = sum(n_arm),
    p = n_arm[stark=="small"] / n
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    w = n
  )

# overall impacts

school_summaries %>%
  gather("subject","impact_j", readk, mathk) %>%
  group_by(subject) %>%
  summarise(
    impact = weighted.mean(impact_j, w = w),
    SE_CR0 = sqrt(sum(w^2 * (impact_j - impact)^2) / sum(w)^2),
    SE_CR2 = sqrt(sum(w^2 * (impact_j - impact)^2 / (1 - w / sum(w))) / sum(w)^2),
    df_CR2 = 1 / (sum(w^2 / (sum(w) - w)^2) - 
                    2 * sum(w^3 / (sum(w) - w)^2) / sum(w) + 
                    sum(w^2 / (sum(w) - w))^2 / sum(w)^2)
  ) %>%
  knitr::kable(digits = 2)
```

The CR0 and CR2 standard errors match the results from `coef_test`, as do the Satterthwaite degrees of freedom. Note that the degrees of freedom are equal to `{r} round(CR2$df[1], 1)` in this case, a bit less than $J - 1 = 22$ due to variation in the weight assigned to each school.
